channel.title: The Buck Stops Here

channel.itunes:subtitle: The Buck Stops Here
channel.itunes:author: NDTV
channel.itunes:summary: A show with Barkha Dutt that brings you the big interviews, debates, all the elections news and of course, the very latest from our turbulent neighbours.
channel.description: A show with Barkha Dutt that brings you the big interviews, debates, all the elections news and of course, the very latest from our turbulent neighbours.

item.title: After Islamabad's Defiance, Dead-End Dialogue for India-Pakistan?
item.itunes:author: Barkha Dutt
item.itunes:subtitle: After Delhi dissolved dialogue, Pakistan has stared back. Pakistan High Commissioner today met separatists despite India's warning. we debate: Are India-Pakistan relations back on the brink? Has Kashmir moved from backburner to centrestage?
item.itunes:summary: After Delhi dissolved dialogue, Pakistan has stared back. Pakistan High Commissioner today met separatists despite India's warning. On The Buck Stops Here, we debate: Are India-Pakistan relations back on the brink? Has Kashmir moved from backburner to centrestage? And will a dead-end dialogue be the fate of all India-Pakistan talks unless Delhi talks to the real boss in Pakistan - the Army?
item.itunes:keywords: India-Pakistan talk,Foreign Secretary-Level Talks,India-Pakistan,Kashmiri separatist,The Buck Stops Here,Pakistan High Commissioner

item.title: India-Pakistan Talks Off: Stern Message or Over-Reaction?
item.itunes:author: Barkha Dutt
item.itunes:subtitle: Modi government calls off talks with Pakistan over its High Commissioner's invitation to Kashmiri separatists for "consultations". On The Buck Stops Here, we debate: is this an over-reaction or overdue firmness?
item.itunes:summary: Modi government calls off talks with Pakistan over its High Commissioner's invitation to Kashmiri separatists for "consultations". On The Buck Stops Here, we debate: is this an over-reaction or overdue firmness? Is PM Modi's Pakistan policy a break from Vajpayee-Manmohan approach? And will scrapping of talks weaken Nawaz Sharif's authority in Pakistan?
item.itunes:keywords: India-Pakistan talk,Foreign Secretary-Level Talks,India-Pakistan,Kashmiri separatist,The Buck Stops Here

item.title: Is the Government Being Over-Cautious with Islamic State Militants in Iraq?
item.itunes:author: Amitabh Pashupati Revi
item.itunes:subtitle: Is New Delhi's response commensurate with its regional power ambitions? Is New Delhi being overcautious towards militants of the Islamic State in Iraq because of the Indian hostages held there?
item.itunes:summary: Is New Delhi's response commensurate with its regional power ambitions? Is New Delhi being overcautious towards militants of the Islamic State in Iraq because of the Indian hostages held there? How much should we fear the Islamic State in Iraq, regionally and globally, considering it has virtually erased the Sykes Pikot line -- the border between Iraq and Syria? We debate on The Buck Stops Here.
item.itunes:keywords: Islamic State,Iraq,Indian Hostage,Militants,Militants in Iraq,The Buck Stops Here,ISIS

item.title: India's Biggest Naval Destroyer: Are We a Serious Maritime Power?
item.itunes:author: Vishnu Som
item.itunes:subtitle: As the Prime Minister commissions a new India-built destroyer, we look at the growth of the Indian Navy and place it in the context of where we stand vis-a-vis China. Are we a serious maritime power? We debate on The Buck Stops Here.
item.itunes:summary: As the Prime Minister commissions a new India-built destroyer, we look at the growth of the Indian Navy and place it in the context of where we stand vis-a-vis China. Are we a serious maritime power? We debate on The Buck Stops Here.
item.itunes:keywords: India's Biggest Naval Destroyer,INS Kolkata,Narendra Modi,Prime Minister,The Buck Stops Here

item.title: PM's First Speech: Dramatic Departure from Past?
item.itunes:author: Barkha Dutt
item.itunes:subtitle: Without a scripted speech or a bullet-proof glass, PM Narendra Modi tries to make a direct connect with the people in his maiden Independence Day address. He spoke on how he was "an outsider to Delhi" and called upon foreign investors to "make in India".
item.itunes:summary: Without a scripted speech or a bullet-proof glass, PM Narendra Modi tries to make a direct connect with the people in his maiden Independence Day address. He spoke on how he was "an outsider to Delhi" and called upon foreign investors to "make in India". Addressing the nation from the ramparts of Red Fort, he also put issues of women safety and sanitation at the centre stage with his speech. We ask if Mr Modi's first speech is a dramatic departure from the past?
item.itunes:keywords: Independence Day,Modi's speech,Prime Minister,Narendra Modi,PM's First Speech,The Buck Stops Here

item.title: Judges Bill - Greater Accountability or Greater Political Control?
item.itunes:author: Barkha Dutt
item.itunes:subtitle: On The Buck Stops Here, as Parliament passes the landmark but highly controversial Judicial Appointments Bill, we debate - does the Bill bring greater transparency to the appointment of judges or is it throttling the judiciary?
item.itunes:summary: On The Buck Stops Here, as Parliament passes the landmark but highly controversial Judicial Appointments Bill, we debate - does the Bill bring greater transparency to the appointment of judges or is it throttling the judiciary? And does the unity on the bill in Parliament despite objections by some jurists indicate a rupture in the Executive-Judiciary relationship?
item.itunes:keywords: Judges Appointment bill,Chief Justice of India collegium system,judges bill,Lok Sabha,Rajya Sabha,The Buck Stops Here

item.title: Parliament Split on Communal Violence: Mirroring Divide on Ground?
item.itunes:author: Barkha Dutt
item.itunes:subtitle: As Parliament debated rising incidents of communal violence in the country, BJP MP Yogi Adityanath said if state administrations show "bias", Hindus will have to respond at their own level. Was his comment forceful or inflammatory?
item.itunes:summary: As Parliament debated rising incidents of communal violence in the country, BJP MP Yogi Adityanath said if state administrations show "bias", Hindus will have to respond at their own level. Was his comment forceful or inflammatory? Who is most to blame for politics of polarization? And does the split in Parliament mirror the divide on the ground?
item.itunes:keywords: Communal violence bill,BJP,Congress,protests in Lok Sabha,communal violence in Uttar Pradesh,Rahul Gandhi,Yogi Adityanath,Asaduddin Owaisi,Hindus,muslimsThe Buck stops Here

item.title: Bharat Ratna: Civilian Honour or Political Award?
item.itunes:author: Barkha Dutt
item.itunes:subtitle: Has the nation's highest civilian honour, the Bharat Ratna, been trivialised by politics? Is India's jewel Major Dhyan Chand a neglected 'Ratna' so far? And will popular say in deciding the awards strengthen its credibility or reduce it? We debate.
item.itunes:summary: On The Buck Stops Here, we debate: Has the nation's highest civilian honour, the Bharat Ratna, been trivialised by politics? Is India's jewel Major Dhyan Chand a neglected 'Ratna' so far? And will popular say in deciding the awards strengthen its credibility or reduce it?
item.itunes:keywords: Bharat Ratna,India's highest civilian honour,Bharat Ratna award,Atal Bihari Vajpayee,Major Dhyan Chand

item.title: Judges Appointment Debate: Government vs Judiciary?
item.itunes:author: Barkha Dutt
item.itunes:subtitle: On a day Chief Justice of India RM Lodha defended the collegium system of appointment of judges, Modi govt moved the Judicial Appointments Bill in Parliament. On The show, we debate: is the Chief Justice of India right in defending the collegium system?
item.itunes:summary: On a day Chief Justice of India RM Lodha defended the collegium system of appointment of judges, Modi government moved the Judicial Appointments Bill in Parliament. On The Buck Stops Here, we debate: is the Chief Justice of India right in defending the collegium system? Can judges be their own jury?
item.itunes:keywords: Judges Appointment,Chief Justice of India RM,Lodha,CJI,collegium system,judges,KL Manjunath,controversial judge,Haryana High Court,The Buck Stops Here

item.title: Reports of Bharat Ratna For Netaji, Vajpayee - Honour Overdue or Awards Politics?
item.itunes:author: NDTV
item.itunes:subtitle: There is speculation that the government may have shortlisted five names for Bharat Ratna awards including former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, Madan Mohan Malviya, Kanshi Ram and Major Dhyanchand.
item.itunes:summary: There is speculation that the government may have shortlisted five names for Bharat Ratna awards including former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose, Madan Mohan Malviya, Kanshi Ram and Major Dhyanchand. But even before some or all of those names are formally announced, a big controversy has broken out. While the BJP says many important icons have been ignored by previous regimes, the Congress wants to know why the NDA is delving deep into history to select its candidates. So is this an honour that's way overdue for some of India's biggest icons or is it competitive awards politics?
item.itunes:keywords: Atal Bihari Vajpayee,Bharat Ratna,Dhyanchand,Madan Mohan Malviya,Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose,Rajiv Gandhi,UPA government,The Buck Stops Here
